    "number": 192584,
    "data": "2,4,5,6,8,10,11,13,17,23,31,37,41,47,53,61,67,79,83,89,101,103,107,131,137,139,149,167,179,223,263,269,283,311,317,359,367,499,557,607,619,643,719,787,809,823,857,1031,1049,1097,1193,1433,1439,1579,1619",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and xy+1 is a prime, then xy+1 is in S, and 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 are in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192580 and A192584.  The number of terms in this finite sequence is 104. The greatest term is 15845273."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Giovanni Resta, <a href=\"/A192584/b192584.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..104</a> (full sequence)"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10}; seq = {}; new = start; While[new != {},",
        "seq = Union[seq, new]; fresh = new; new = {}; Do[If[PrimeQ[u = x*y + 1], If[! MemberQ[seq, u], AppendTo[new, u]]], {x, seq}, {y, fresh}]]; seq (* _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 21 2013 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580, A192583."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,fini,full",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 04 2011",
    "ext": [
        "Corrected by _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 21 2013"
    ],
